alert.note: Alert for Anne Arundel; Baltimore; Baltimore City (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 12 at 11:58PM EDT until September 13 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT WEDNESDAY FOR NORTH CENTRAL ANNE ARUNDEL AND SOUTHWESTERN BALTIMORE COUNTIES AND EXTREME SOUTHWESTERN BALTIMORE CITY... At 1158 PM EDT, The Baltimore County 911 Center have have been reports of numerous water rescues in the city of Baltimore and Catonsville. Doppler radar indicated that 2 to 4 inches of rain fell within an hour due to showers and thunderstorms. Additional rainfall amounts up to an inch are expected within portions of the warned area over the next couple hours. Excess runoff from the rainfall will continue to produce flash flooding. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baltimore... Pikesville... Elkridge... Ellicott City... Towson... Catonsville... Woodlawn... Randallstown... Parkville... Owings Mills... Eldersburg... Milford Mill... Lochearn... Arbutus... Brooklyn Park... Mays Chapel... Ilchester... Linthicum... Garrison... Lansdowne... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
